problemStatement.formal: \text{Relativization: } \exists A, B. P^A = NP^A \land P^B \neq NP^B
problemStatement.plain: Formalize the three major barriers to proving P ≠ NP: relativization (Baker-Gill-Solovay), natural proofs (Razborov-Rudich), and algebrization (Aaronson-Wigderson).

currentState.focus: MIP = NEXP formalization with full interactive proof hierarchy
currentState.activeApproach: Abstract complexity class definitions with barrier theorems.
currentState.nextAction: Add PCP theorem or zero-knowledge proofs

knowledge.progressSummary: Surveyed - 2371 lines, 0 sorries. Has MIP=NEXP, IP=PSPACE, all barriers

builtItems.name: verification_power_hierarchy
builtItems.description: P ⊆ NP ⊆ PSPACE = IP ⊂ MIP = NEXP chain

builtItems.name: P_subset_NP_relative
builtItems.description: P^A ⊆ NP^A for any oracle A

builtItems.name: relativization_barrier
builtItems.description: Cannot prove P=NP or P≠NP by relativizing

insights: MIP = NEXP: Non-communicating provers enable cross-examination
IP = PSPACE: Interaction adds verification power
MIP* = RE: Quantum entanglement captures all semi-decidable languages
Three barriers block simple P≠NP proofs
File has 16 parts covering full complexity zoo
nextSteps: Add PCP theorem (NP = PCP(O(log n), O(1)))
